page.title: 01EASTFIELD CAYTON OSGODBY
page.content: The area of this survey lies mainly on a southern slope, bordered on the east by cliffs overlooking Cayton Bay and the North Sea, and encroaching onto the drained Carr flatlands of the Vale of Pickering to the south. About 50% of the area is given over to arable farming, 16% to three post war urban developments, 25% is sea and the remaining 9% being ribbon development, industry, sand and boulder clay cliffs. Running from NW to SE along the coast is the A165 from Scarborough to Filey, with its ribbon pre war housing and 1960's private housing estates on the southern boundary of Scarborough. In the area is the 1950's Scarborough Council / private housing estate of Eastfield with its late 1960's industrial development, and the Saxon village of Cayton and Osgodby with their post war development.
